#summary Information about the .galago.conf file

= Galago Configuration File `=

== File Structure ==

The galago.conf file allows you to specify parameters that are constant for a given system. The file should be written to the home directory, specifically:
  * ~/.galago.conf

This file should be a parameter file. No particular settings are required, there are default values that will be used.

== Parameters ==

{{{
<tmpdir>/path/to/folder</tmpdir>
}}}
Specifies a writable temporary data location. Default is the system variable $TMPDIR.

{{{
<drmaa>
 <mem>####(g|m)</mem>
 <nativeSpec>...</nativeSpec>
 <nativeSpecEach>...</nativeSpecEach>
 <nativeSpecCombined>...</nativeSpecCombined>
</drmaa>
}}
Block of parameters for the drmaa interface. <mem> specifies the amount of memory to use at each node. <nativeSpec> is a string that lists parameters for the drmaa interface. The <nativeSpecEach> and <nativeSpecCombined> parameters provides control over the job submission for these different types of stages. 

Parameter options for this interface may be further extended in the future.

== Example files ==

Non-cluster computer: 
{{{
$cat ~/.galago.conf
<parameters>
 <tmpdir>/tmp/galagoTmp</tmpdir>
</parameters>
}}}

Drmaa supported cluster 1:
{{{
$cat ~/.galago.conf
<parameters>
 <tmpdir>/tmp/galagoTmp</tmpdir>
 <drmaa>
  <mem>4g</mem>
  <nativeSpec>-l mem_free=4G -l mem_token=4G</nativeSpec>
 </drmaa>
</parameters>
}}}

Drmaa supported cluster 2:
{{{
$cat ~/.galago.conf
<parameters>
 <tmpdir>/tmp/galagoTmp</tmpdir>
 <drmaa>
  <mem>4g</mem>
  <nativeSpec>-l mem_free=4G -l mem_token=4G</nativeSpec>
  <nativeSpecEach>-q all.q</nativeSpecEach>
  <nativeSpecCombined>-q long.q -l long=TRUE</nativeSpecCombined>
 </drmaa>
</parameters>
}}}
